image.altText: A large amount of rubble, with smoke also visible rising from it

props.synopsis: Israel's attacks in Lebanon will continue for the foreseeable future, a military spokesperson says, despite confirmation Hassan Nasrallah, the leader of the country's main adversary there, had been "eliminated".

title.children: Israel 'determined to keep fighting' in Lebanon despite assassinating Hezbollah chief

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone with his hand in the air

props.synopsis: The leader of the region's most powerful militia and Iran's strongest ally is gone, and Hezbollah, the group he headed, has been decimated by intense Israel attacks. But that doesn't mean it will die with him.

title.children: Nasrallah turned an Islamist militia into a political force that will outlive him

image.altText: A man wearing a tie stands indoors, looking ahead. A neutral expression on his face.

props.synopsis: Australia's airline graveyard is littered with failed carriers – with two more joining the ranks of the fallen this year. Bill Astling believes he has what it takes to break into the market.

title.children: This man says he's starting Australia's next airline. The odds of success aren't good

image.altText: albanese walks down a corridor holding papers, a grimace on his face

props.synopsis: With less than a year until the next election, the words of party elder Gough Whitlam could be ringing in Anthony Albanese's ears.

title.children: 'Frightened to put a foot wrong': The 40-year-old quote that rings true for Albanese today

image.altText: A white man with facial difference standing outside and leaning on a brick wall

props.synopsis: A year on from the disability royal commission's final report, ABC NEWS takes a closer look at one of the biggest and most contentious proposals for change — phasing out segregated employment.

title.children: 'An affront to dignity': The system allowing people with disability to be paid $6 an hour

image.altText: Composite image of Brisbane Lions Joe Daniher, Cam  Rayner and Eric Hipwood during play in the 2024 AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: The Ashcroft name returns to the premiership podium with Will's Norm Smith win, Eric Hipwood channels Jason Akermanis and loyal servant Dayne Zorko finally gets his moment. Here are the quick hits from the 2024 AFL grand final.

title.children: Grand final quick hits: Ashcroft makes history, Cam makes it Rayn and Hipwood mimics a legend

image.altText: Sugra Barkati walks with supporters while being escorted by armed soldiers.

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old and her brother, 11, emerge as unexpected symbols of resilience as they draw crowds to rallies across Kashmir and campaign for their father — a jailed separatist.

title.children: How a teen girl became a symbol of resistance amid critical elections in Indian-controlled Kashmir

image.altText: Kristen and Warren look down at their son Patrick, both smiling, as he pats a cat on the head.

props.synopsis: When Andrew Leech trained as a GP 11 years ago, he thought the main issues he'd be seeing in children would be coughs and colds. He wasn't anticipating the wave of children and teens battling mental health problems.

title.children: More children are taking drugs after nothing else helped their anxiety, and parents say they're getting judged

image.altText: Photo: Matt Davis

props.synopsis: Exposure to violence defined Darryl's early life, before he turned to violence himself. Today, Darryl teaches positive masculinity and uses boxing to empower communities and help break the cycle.

title.children: Darryl Gardiner has been a victim, an offender and a survivor. His voice is crucial

image.altText: A man in a suit sitting and speaking, with his arms raised, gesturing

props.synopsis: Trump is hoping to win a second term as US president in November. Here's what that would mean for the criminal cases against him.

title.children: What happens with Trump's criminal cases if he wins the election?

image.altText: An orange flash had been enveloped by the great uprush of water. Immense clouds of smoke, steam and spray burst into the air.

props.synopsis: Indonesia and Solomon Islands have signed up to ban the bomb. Experts say Australia's reluctance to do so could spur tension with its neighbours.

title.children: Between a nuke and a hard place: Why Australia hasn't signed a treaty to ban nuclear weapons

image.altText: Two fisheries patrol boats on the water

props.synopsis: Fisheries officers in NSW say they are facing increasingly dangerous situations when dealing with poachers and organised crime gangs and are calling for better workplace protections.

title.children: Fisheries officers demand stab-proof vests and capsicum spray saying poachers and criminal gangs make their jobs too dangerous

image.altText: Nathan Cleary hugs Penrith panthers teammates during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Penrith beats Cronulla 26-6 to reach their fifth NRL grand final in as many years, setting up a rematch against 2020 opponents the Melbourne Storm.

title.children: Nathan Cleary shrugs off late injury scare as Panthers reach fifth straight NRL grand final

image.altText: Chris Fagan and the Brisbane Lions with the AFL premiership cup.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan admits his side "were looking down the barrel" at the halfway mark of the season, before recovering to reach the finals and claim the club's first AFL premiership since 2003.

title.children: Resilience, hard work and Ted Lasso: How Fagan and the Lions fought back to achieve premiership glory

image.altText: Penrith Panthers coach Ivan Cleary looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Panthers coach Ivan Cleary says he is deeply concerned about the state of the NRL's video refereeing heading into next week's grand final clash with Melbourne after his team was denied a try by a dubious obstruction ruling.

title.children: Ivan Cleary calls out bunker official by name over 'terrible' obstruction call in preliminary final win

image.altText: An older woman in a black robe holds a magic wand as she looks serious.

props.synopsis: No matter what generation they are from, fans will have fond memories of a beloved character played by Maggie Smith.

title.children: From Professor McGonagall to Miss Jean Brodie, these are the roles Maggie Smith will be remembered for

image.altText: A man poses with a thumbs up

props.synopsis: The mayor's plea came a day after prosecutors unsealed an indictment accusing him of taking $US100,000 in flights and stays in opulent hotel suites from people tied to Türkiye.

title.children: New York Mayor Eric Adams pleads not guilty to federal bribery charges as he rebuffs calls to resign

image.altText: A satellite image of the storm over the United States.

props.synopsis: Hurricane Helene caused dozens of deaths and billions of dollars' worth of destruction across several states in the south-eastern United States.

title.children: Dozens dead and millions still without power after Helene's deadly march across south-eastern US

image.altText: A composite image of Jim Chalmers and Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Labor's inability to come clean about who ordered the Treasury to work on negative gearing left the government and prime minister Anthony Albanese smeared as tricky, dissembling and guilty of treating voters with contempt.

title.children: 48 hours of confusion has backfired on Labor, when they could have just come clean

image.altText: A close-up of an elderly woman standing in the doorway of her caravan, wearing a striped shirt.

props.synopsis: Dozens of grey nomads bought houses in a caravan park on the promise it "couldn't be sold from underneath them". Then it was.

title.children: 'This must be a joke': Caravan park put up for sale without home owners' knowledge

image.altText: Half of a white metal hull with debris around it lies on the ocean floor, with blue water and harsh light

props.synopsis: A US Coast Guard hearing into the 2023 Titan submersible disaster has ended but not before some dramatic revelations. Here are the key takeaways.

title.children: From talk of buying off congressmen, to previous malfunctions — all the key takeaways from the Titan sub hearings

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment Group's shares bombed on Friday, losing close to half their already heavily discounted value, after the company narrowly avoided collapse, securing a last-minute $200 million bailout from its bankers.

title.children: How the end of money laundering sank Australia's casinos

image.altText: Police thumbnail

props.synopsis: Thousands of vacancies for police officers across Australia are making it harder for forces to protect the public, unions say.

title.children: Police are leaving the force 'in droves' with thousands of unfilled positions intensifying workloads

image.altText: Wallabies players look dejected

props.synopsis: The Wallabies started fast, but ran out of steam against the All Blacks in Wellington, losing 33-13 to end a Bledisloe clean sweep.

title.children: All Blacks punish Wallabies with comfortable victory

image.altText: An entrance to an airport reading "Welcome to Rome".

props.synopsis: It was a Wednesday morning in Rome when Italian police received an Interpol red notice from Victorian police. Within two days, Perry Kouroumblis would be under arrest for the killings of two Australian women almost five decades ago.

title.children: When Italian Police received a red alert on a wanted man all the way from Melbourne, they got to work fast

image.altText: Singer Slim Dusty leans on a car near Uluru

props.synopsis: Australia's "King of Country Music" performed for a number of remote Queensland towns over his 60-year career, and the communities have never forgotten it.

title.children: Why Slim Dusty's friendship with Indigenous Australia is worth singing about

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a shady tree

props.synopsis: A consumer group has advised Australians to "shop around" for cheaper groceries, but for people in regional areas, choice is a luxury they don't have.

title.children: 'We don't have a choice': Regional Australians paying the price of supermarket duopoly

image.altText: A Chinese woman offers a prayer in front of  flowers.

props.synopsis: The deadly stabbing of a 10-year-old boy in China has raised alarm among the Japanese community in the country while triggering a flood of criticism of the incident and extreme nationalist comments on Chinese social media.

title.children: Why has the fatal stabbing of a schoolboy divided the Chinese internet?

image.altText: Two people holding a puppy while getting vaccinated,

props.synopsis: The resort island is struggling to eradicate rabies despite the efforts of both the Australian and Indonesian governments.

title.children: The WHO wants to end dog-mediated rabies deaths by 2030. But in Bali, they are still common

image.altText: NZF_0046 destroyed house Russia invasion odyssey

props.synopsis: After Ukraine launched a surprise assault on Russian territory in August, the ABC's Europe correspondent Kathryn Diss and camera operator Fletcher were invited by the military to visit an occupied town in Russia.

title.children: ABC crew becomes subject of Russian criminal investigation for crossing border from Ukraine

image.altText: A split image showing a police vehicle parked next to a marquee on an outback road and a man with dark hair and a moustache.

props.synopsis: Gary John Schmidt's remains were discovered on the outskirts of Kununurra in 2015. Genetic genealogy technology has finally allowed authorities to identify him, but the circumstances surrounding his death remain mysterious.

title.children: Identity of man whose body was found on outback highway confirmed after almost 10 years

image.altText: An elderly Indigenous woman sits beside the red road with a rake and bucket.

props.synopsis: Food insecurity leads to disastrous health outcomes for the most the isolated. Some believe a focus on native ingredients could help turn things around.

title.children: Many Australians struggle with chronic diseases. Daisy believes native 'superfood' could improve their health

image.altText: A person being escorted to an ambulance by police.

props.synopsis: Two people are rescued and another two swim ashore after their boat capsizes two kilometres off WA's Mid West coast.

title.children: Two people swim to safety after boat capsizes about 2km off WA coast
